DataElement.preferredName: Study Chair Disease Staging Review Outcome Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Pertains to assessment of an authorized person, usually the study chair, whether the procedures required for staging are complete or incomplete.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who is responsible for providing overall management for the operation of the study, and for reporting to the Data and Safety Monitoring Board. The continual review of the data by an independent individual or DSMB assures the investigator(s) that the trial can continue without jeopardizing patient safety._The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made._The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who is responsible for providing overall management for the operation of the study, and for reporting to the Data and Safety Monitoring Board. The continual review of the data by an independent individual or DSMB assures the investigator(s) that the trial can continue without jeopardizing patient safety.

Concepts.definition: A person who is responsible for providing overall management for the operation of the study, and for reporting to the Data and Safety Monitoring Board. The continual review of the data by an independent individual or DSMB assures the investigator(s) that the trial can continue without jeopardizing patient safety.

Property.preferredDefinition: Performing exams and tests to learn the extent of the cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. It is important to know the stage of the disease in order to plan the best treatment.:The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.
The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made._A condition or state at a particular time._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.

Concepts.definition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Performing exams and tests to learn the extent of the cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. It is important to know the stage of the disease in order to plan the best treatment.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.
A condition or state at a particular time.
